pages.title: Grypania
pages.text: $(l)Temporal Range:$() Paleoproterozoic (Rhyacian - Orosirian - Statherian) - Mesoproterozoic (Calymmian - Ectasian - Stenian) - Neoproterozoic (Tonian - Cryogenian - Ediacaran)$(br2)$(l)Habitat:$() Marine$(br2)Domain:$(br)>$(o)incertae sedis

Grypania is an extremely early, tube shaped fossil from the Proterozoic Eon. It could have been a bacterial colony or a eukaryotic alga. The time range for this taxon extended for around 1200 million years due to the oldest probable Grypania being dated to 2100 mya.
$(l)Eats:$() N/A$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() N/A$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() N/A$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Shears
